t: Exodus 6
Then*p the Lord*s said to Moses, “Now you will see what I will do to Pharaoh: Because of my mighty hand he will let them go; because of my mighty hand he will drive them out of his country.”
God*p also said to Moses, “I am the Lord.*s
I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob as God Almighty, but by my name the Lord*s I did not make myself fully known to them.
I also established my covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, where they resided as foreigners.
Moreover, I have heard the groaning of the Israelites, whom the Egyptians are enslaving, and I have remembered my covenant.

“Therefore,*p say to the Israelites: ‘I am the Lord,*s and I will bring you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians. I will free you from being slaves to them, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with mighty acts of judgment.
I will take you as my own people, and I will be your God. Then you will know that I am the Lord*s your God, who brought you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians.
And I will bring you to the land I swore with uplifted hand to give to Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob. I will give it to you as a possession. I am the Lord*s .’ ”
Moses*p reported this to the Israelites, but they did not listen to him because of their discouragement and harsh labor.
Then*p the Lord*s said to Moses,
“Go, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites go out of his country.”
But*p Moses said to the Lord,*s “If the Israelites will not listen to me, why would Pharaoh listen to me, since I speak with faltering lips?”
Family Record of Moses and Aaron
Now*p the Lord*s spoke to Moses and Aaron about the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he commanded them to bring the Israelites out of Egypt.
These*pln were the heads of their families: The*pln sons of Reuben the firstborn son of Israel were Hanok and Pallu, Hezron and Karmi. These were the clans of Reuben.
The*ln sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman. These were the clans of Simeon.
These*ln were the names of the sons of Levi according to their records: Gershon, Kohath and Merari. Levi lived 137 years.
The*ln sons of Gershon, by clans, were Libni and Shimei.
The*ln sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel. Kohath lived 133 years.
The*ln sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These*ln were the clans of Levi according to their records.
Amram*ln married his father’s sister Jochebed, who bore him Aaron and Moses. Amram lived 137 years.
The*ln sons of Izhar were Korah, Nepheg and Zikri.
The*ln sons of Uzziel were Mishael, Elzaphan and Sithri.
Aaron*ln married Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab and sister of Nahshon, and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
The*ln sons of Korah were: Assir, Elkanah and Abiasaph. These were the Korahite clans.
Eleazar*ln son of Aaron married one of the daughters of Putiel, and she bore him Phinehas. These*pln were the heads of the Levite families, clan by clan.
It*p was this Aaron and Moses to whom the Lord*s said, “Bring the Israelites out of Egypt by their divisions.”
They were the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt about bringing the Israelites out of Egypt—this same Moses and Aaron.
Aaron to Speak for Moses
Now*p when the Lord*s spoke to Moses in Egypt,
he said to him, “I am the Lord.*s Tell Pharaoh king of Egypt everything I tell you.”
But*p Moses said to the Lord,*s “Since I speak with faltering lips, why would Pharaoh listen to me?”
